TopicTitle: What did you LEARN in KSP today?

Articles.Content:
I have only had the game for about two weeks and I have two manned ships in permanent orbit around Kerbin with no fuel. I have finally come to grips with rendezvous and docking and have made a resolution. Do not launch any manned mission that does not have a docking port on it! You may have to organize a rescue mission. I also learned not to stick a radial parachute over a crew hatch!

Edited October 9, 2013 by benzman

I learned that 1.25m probes are the same as any other probes.

All probes were created equal?

EDIT: A suggestion, drop the kerbals on their heads.
I learned that I have a memory leak somewhere. Loaded the game up and it crashed right away, maxed out memory. My Gamedata folder is only 1.1GB.

I learned that 1.25m probes are the same as any other probes.

All probes were created equal?

EDIT: A suggestion, drop the kerbals on their heads.

And you can rotate the kerbals to fall on their heads by left-clicking and dragging on top of the Kerbal. I just learned that the other day!

I have only had the game for about two weeks and I have two manned ships in permanent orbit around Kerbin with no fuel. I have finally come to grips with rendezvous and docking and have made a resolution. Do not launch any manned mission that does not have a docking port on it! You may have to organize a rescue mission.

You can send up a rescue ship and rendezvous, then just EVA the guys over. No port needed.

You can send up a rescue ship and rendezvous, then just EVA the guys over. No port needed.

yes, that is what I thought I would have to do.
I learned how to crash the game reliably with mod code.
I learned not to do retro burns too soon after dropping a stage.

I learned that doing a direct return to kerbin is not ideal. Thankfully I had a good enough engine to land.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I pulled 43 gees.

Edited October 9, 2013 by Supernovy
Fixed album embedding

I learned not to do retro burns too soon after dropping a stage.

This.

I obliterated my kerbonauts on their trip back from the Mun.

Shame!

I learn't that F5 is your friend......

And clicking on a module connected to 150 others in VAB while having quadruplicate active yields rather interesting results:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Yesterday I learned keep decent safe distance from Joole. Dunno if it was a bug or just game physics but I was sucked in when passed ~500km, checked before pass that orbit was established.

I learned, that low gravity is no friend of rovers but kerbals can headbutt fliped rovers back on its wheels.

But I will build a hoverboard instead now.
